main event: A radar and visual sighting of an unidentified flying object occurred on June 8, 1966 near Columbus, Mississippi.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright, flashing light that appeared to be stationary and blinking in a random sequence of red, green, and white flashes.
The object suddenly accelerated and disappeared from sight in a matter of seconds, moving at an estimated speed in excess of 1500 mph.
The radar tracking and visual observation of the object continued for approximately 15 minutes.
The object was estimated to be 50 feet in diameter and emitting a brilliant, blue-green color.
The object maneuvered throughout the tracking, at times appearing motionless and then accelerating to tremendous speeds.
sighted object: Bright, flashing light; large blue-green object
witnesses: Military personnel at SAC control and radar operators
